business_positives: UK's largest pub operator by site count (~4,500 pubs)
High coupon bonds attractive to investors

Preparing GBP 1bn pub sale - forced asset disposals to deleverage. Out-of-court restructuring in Jan 2024. Distress score elevated at 20.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: Leverage persistently HIGH at 7.5-8x. EBITDA growing but debt growing faster. Net income NEGATIVE every year and worsening. 9M24-25 EBITDA declined 4% YoY.

credit_opinion.summary: Stonegate is a CHALLENGED credit despite 'performing' lifecycle status. Net leverage of 7.6x is very high. Net income is NEGATIVE every year and worsening. Credit reports note NEGATIVE free cash flow. Rating downgrades in 2025 prompted accelerated asset disposal plans (GBP 1bn pub sale). The company had an out-of-court restructuring in Jan 2024. Two of three bond tranches trading BELOW PAR (98.74, 99.69). Distress score of 20 is elevated. While property values provide some comfort and CFFO is positive, the capital structure is unsustainable without significant deleveraging from asset sales.
